abilities: Gluttony: This Pokémon must eat its held berry when it falls below ½ of its maximum HP.

name: Crabrawler

Iron Fist: When attacking with a punch-based move (Mega Punch, Dynamic Punch, IceFireThunder Punch, etc.), this Pokémon may roll the damage twice and choose either total.
"Egg_Moves": Amnesia, Endeavor, Superpower, Wide Guard 20
hidden_ability: Anger Point: After suffering a critical hit, this Pokémon doubles the damage dice for a single move it activates on the following turn.
evolution: Crabrawler can evolve into Crabominable at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Boxing Pokémon. Its hard pincers are well suited to both offense and defense. Fights between two Crabrawler are like boxing matches.

name: Crabominable
abilities: Hyper Cutter: This Pokémon’s attack or damage bonuses cannot be decreased by an opponent’s moves.
Iron Fist: When attacking with a punch-based move (Mega Punch, Dynamic Punch, IceFireThunder Punch, etc.), this Pokémon may roll the damage twice and choose either total.
hidden_ability: Anger Point: After suffering a critical hit, this Pokémon doubles the damage dice for a single move it activates on the following turn.

asi.description: The Woolly Crab Pokémon. It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

name: Oricorio Baile Style
abilities: Dancer: If any creature within sight of this Pokémon activates a move with Dance in its name, this Pokémon may immediately use one of its moves as a reaction.
"Egg_Moves": Captivate, Pluck, Safeguard, Tailwind 21 Oricorio Pom-Pom

asi.description: The Dancing Pokémon. It wins the hearts of its enemies with its passionate dancing and then uses the opening it creates to burn them up with blazing flames.

form_change: This Pokémon's default form is Baile Style, but can change by giving it a certain kind of Nectar. Yellow Nectar changes it to Pom-Pom Style, Pink Nectar changes it to Pa'u Style, Purple Nectar changes it to Sensu Style, and Red Nectar reverts its form to Baile Style.

name: Style
abilities: Dancer: If any creature within sight of this Pokémon activates a move with Dance in its name, this Pokémon may immediately use one of its moves as a reaction.
"Egg_Moves": Captivate, Pluck, Safeguard, Tailwind

asi.description: The Dancing Pokémon. It lifts its opponents’ spirits with its cheerful dance moves. When they let their guard down, it electrocutes them with a jolt.

form_change: This Pokémon's default form is Pom- Pom Style, but can change by giving it a certain kind of Nectar. Red Nectar changes it to Baile Style, Pink Nectar changes it to Pa'u Style, Purple Nectar changes it to Sensu Style, and Yellow Nectar reverts its form to Pom-Pom Style.

name: Oricorio Pa'u Style
abilities: Dancer: If any creature within sight of this Pokémon activates a move with Dance in its name, this Pokémon may immediately use one of its moves as a reaction.
"Egg_Moves": Captivate, Pluck, Safeguard, Tailwind 22

asi.description: The Dancing Pokémon. It relaxes its opponents with its elegant dancing. When they let their guard down,it showers them with psychic energy.

form_change: This Pokémon's default form is Pa'u Style, but can change by giving it a certain kind of Nectar. Yellow Nectar changes it to Pom-Pom Style, Red Nectar changes it to Baile Style, Purple Nectar changes it to Sensu Style, and Pink Nectar reverts its form to Pa'u Style.

name: Oricorio Sensu Style
abilities: Dancer: If any creature within sight of this Pokémon activates a move with Dance in its name, this Pokémon may immediately use one of its moves as a reaction.
"Egg_Moves": Captivate, Pluck, Safeguard, Tailwind

asi.description: The Dancing Pokémon. It charms its opponents with its refined dancing. When they let their guard down, it places a curse on them that will bring on their demise.

form_change: This Pokémon's default form is Sensu Style, but can change by giving it a certain kind of Nectar. Yellow Nectar changes it to Pom-Pom Style, Pink Nectar changes it to Pa'u Style, Red Nectar changes it to Baile Style, and Purple Nectar reverts its form to Sensu Style.

name: Cutiefly
abilities: Honey Gather: At the end of each battle, this Pokémon may roll a d20. On a result of 20, its trainer adds a Honey to its inventory.
Shield Dust: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.
"Egg_Moves": Baton Pass, Bestow, Moonblast, Powder, Skill Swap, "Speed" Swap, Sticky Web 23
hidden_ability: Sweet Veil: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.
evolution: Cutiefly can evolve into Ribombee at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Bee Fly Pokémon. Nectar and pollen are its favorite fare. In fields of flowers, it gets into skirmishes with Butterfree over food.

name: Ribombee
abilities: Honey Gather: At the end of each battle, this Pokémon may roll a d20. On a result of 20, its trainer adds a Honey to its inventory.
Shield Dust: Once per long rest, this Pokémon can ignore a negative status condition that results from an enemy move.
hidden_ability: Sweet Veil: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.

asi.description: The Bee Fly Pokémon. Rain makes pollen damp, so Ribombee hates rain. When it sees ominous clouds,it finds a hollow in a tree, where it waits stock-still.

name: Rockruff
abilities: Keen Eye: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.
Vital Spirit: This Pokémon cannot be put to sleep.
"Egg_Moves": Crush Claw, Fire Fang, Sucker Punch, Thrash, Thunder Fang 24
hidden_ability: Steadfast: Once per long rest, when this Pokémon fails a saving throw against a negative status condition, it can choose to pass instead.
evolution: Starting at level 9, Rockruff can evolve into Lycanroc Midday Form during the morning, Lycanroc Dusk Form in the afternoon, or Lycanroc Midnight Form at night. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 14 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Puppy Pokémon. As they develop, their disposition grows more violent and aggressive. Many Trainers find them too much to handle and abandon them.

name: Lycanroc Midday Form
abilities: Keen Eye: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.
Sand Rush: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage, and its speed is doubled in desert terrain,or during a Sandstorm.
hidden_ability: Steadfast: Once per long rest, when this Pokémon fails a saving throw against a negative status condition, it can choose to pass instead.

asi.description: The Wolf Pokémon. The sharp rocks in its mane can cut like knives. Lycanroc wears its prey down by degrees before finishing them off.

name: Lycanroc Midnight Form
abilities: Keen Eye: This Pokémon ignores disadvantage when it relates to sight.
Sand Rush: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage, and its speed is doubled in desert terrain,or during a Sandstorm.
hidden_ability: No Guard: Any attack made by or against this Pokémon has advantage.

asi.description: The Wolf Pokémon. It has no problem ignoring orders it doesn’t like. It doesn’t seem to mind getting hurt at all—as long as it can finish off its opponent.

name: Lycanroc Dusk Form
abilities: Tough Claws: A successful melee attack by this Pokémon automatically gets STAB, regardless of its type. If it would normally get STAB, double the STAB bonus when adding to damage.

asi.description: The Wolf Pokémon. Bathed in the setting sun of evening, Lycanroc has undergone a special kind of evolution. An intense fighting spirit underlies its calmness.

name: Wishiwashi Solo Form
abilities: Schooling: Beginning at level 5, this Pokémon may change to School Form as a free action when it begins its turn above 25% of its maximum health. In School Form, the Pokémon adds 5 to its AC and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability scores (Additional CON does not alter this Pokemon's HP in this form). The Pokémon reverts back to Solo Form when it falls below 25% of maximum health,and must complete a short rest before activating this ability again.
"Egg_Moves": Mist, Muddy Water, Water Pulse, Water Sport, Whirlpool 26 Wishiwashi School

asi.description: The Small Fry Pokémon. They’re weak, so they move in schools. However, they can also often be seen all alone, having strayed from the school.

name: Wishiwashi School Form
abilities: Schooling: Beginning at level 5, this Pokémon may change to School Form as a free action when it begins its turn above 25% of its maximum health. In School Form, the Pokémon adds 5 to its AC and Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution ability scores (Additional CON does not alter this Pokemon's HP in this form). The Pokémon reverts back to Solo Form when it falls below 25% of maximum health,and must complete a short rest before activating this ability again.

asi.description: The Small Fry Pokémon. Wishiwashi assemble in this formation to face off against strong foes. It boasts a strength that earned it the name “demon of the sea.”

name: Mareanie
abilities: Merciless: This Pokémon doubles their damage dice when dealing damage to an opponent that is poisoned.
Limber: This Pokémon is immune to being paralyzed.
"Egg_Moves": Haze, Spit Up, Stockpile, Swallow 27
hidden_ability: Regenerator: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.
evolution: Mareanie can evolve into Toxapex at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Brutal Star Pokémon. They eat Corsola branches, so Mareanie are hated by craftsmen who work with Corsola branches that have naturally fallen off.

name: Toxapex
abilities: Merciless: This Pokémon doubles their damage dice when dealing damage to an opponent that is poisoned.
Limber: This Pokémon is immune to being paralyzed.
hidden_ability: Regenerator: Once per long rest, this Pokémon regains hit points equal to its level when it returns to its Pokéball.

asi.description: The Brutal Star Pokémon. To attack, this Pokémon sends toxic spikes flying at its enemies. Ones that come close get mown down by the claws on its feet.

name: Mudbray
abilities: Own Tempo: This Pokémon is immune to becoming confused.

Stamina: When this Pokémon is damaged by a move,increase its AC by 2 until the start of its next turn. This ability does not stack and will remain in effect if the Pokémon is successfully attacked multiple turns in a row.
"Egg_Moves": Double-Edge, Fissure, Roar, Smack Down 28
hidden_ability: Inner Focus: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.
evolution: Mudbray can evolve into Mudsdale at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Donkey Pokémon. It loves playing in the mud. If it isn’t showered with mud on a daily basis, it gets stressed out and stops listening to its Trainer.

name: Mudsdale
abilities: Own Tempo: This Pokémon is immune to becoming confused.

Stamina: When this Pokémon is damaged by a move,increase its AC by 2 until the start of its next turn. This ability does not stack and will remain in effect if the Pokémon is successfully attacked multiple turns in a row.
hidden_ability: Inner Focus: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.

asi.description: The Draft Horse Pokémon. It remains calm and unmoving no matter the situation. It mixes dirt with the saliva in its mouth to make a special kind of mud.

name: Dewpider
abilities: Water Bubble: This Pokémon is resistant to fire-type damage and immune to the burned condition.
"Egg_Moves": Aurora Beam, Power Split, Spit Up, Sticky Web, Stockpile 29
hidden_ability: Water Absorb: This Pokémon takes no damage from water or water-type attacks. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.
evolution: Dewpider can evolve into Araquanid at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Water Bubble Pokémon. When two Dewpider meet, they display their water bubbles to each other. Then the one with the smaller bubble gets out of the other’s way.

name: Araquanid
abilities: Water Bubble: This Pokémon is resistant to fire-type damage and immune to the burned condition.
hidden_ability: Water Absorb: This Pokémon takes no damage from water or water-type attacks. Instead, half of any water damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

asi.description: The Water Bubble Pokémon. It usually passes its time in the water. When its belly is full, it stores its subdued prey in the water bubble on its head.

name: Fomantis
abilities: Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.
"Egg_Moves": Aromatherapy, Defog, Giga Drain, Leaf Storm, Weather Ball 30
hidden_ability: Contrary: Moves that affect this Pokémon's stats have the opposite effect. (For example, Defense Curl would lower AC by 4. Growl would increase its attack by +1)
evolution: Fomantis can evolve into Lurantis at level 9 and above during the day. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Sickle Grass Pokémon. When the sun rises, Fomantis spreads its four leaves and bathes in the sunlight. The tip of its head has a pleasant aroma.

name: Lurantis
abilities: Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.
hidden_ability: Contrary: Moves that affect this Pokémon's stats have the opposite effect. (For example, Defense Curl would lower AC by 4. Growl would increase its attack by +1)

asi.description: The Bloom Sickle Pokémon. For self-protection, it pretends to be a bug Pokémon. Both of its arms bear keen-edged petals.

name: Morelull
abilities: Illuminate: This Pokémon knows the Light cantrip and can cast it at will.
Effect Spore: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.
"Egg_Moves": Amnesia, Growth, Leech Seed, Poison Powder, Stun Spore 31
hidden_ability: Rain Dish: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.
evolution: Morelull can evolve into Shiinotic at level 7 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Illuminating Pokémon. It scatters its shining spores around itself. Even though they’re dangerous,nighttime tours of forests where Morelull live are popular.

name: Shiinotic
abilities: Illuminate: This Pokémon knows the Light cantrip and can cast it at will.
Effect Spore: When hit by a melee attack, roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of grass damage equal to your proficiency modifier to your attacker.
hidden_ability: Rain Dish: In rainy conditions, this Pokémon heals for an amount of HP equal to its proficiency bonus at the end of each of its turns.

asi.description: The Illuminating Pokémon. It puts its prey to sleep and siphons off their vitality through the tip of its arms. If one of its kind is weakened, it helps by sending it vitality.

name: Salandit
abilities: Corrosion: This Pokémon's moves ignore poison immunity, and can inflict the poisoned status on steel and poison-type Pokémon.
"Egg_Moves": Belch, Fake Out, Knock Off, Sand Attack, Snatch 32
hidden_ability: Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
evolution: A female Salandit can evolve into Salazzle at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Toxic Lizard Pokémon. The males will do whatever the females tell them. They give the females most of their food. Due to malnutrition, the males can’t evolve.

name: Salazzle
abilities: Corrosion: This Pokémon's moves ignore poison immunity, and can inflict the poisoned status on steel and poison-type Pokémon.
hidden_ability: Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.

asi.description: The Toxic Lizard Pokémon. Salazzle lives deep in caves and forces the Salandit it has attracted with its pheromones to serve it.

name: Stufful
abilities: Fluffy: This Pokemon is vulnerable to fire-type moves, but takes half damage from any melee attack (that isn't fire-type).
Klutz: This Pokémon cannot hold an item.
"Egg_Moves": Defense Curl, Force Palm, Rollout, Stomp 33
hidden_ability: Cute Charm: Once per short rest, you can impose disadvantage on an enemy attack roll of your choice.
evolution: Stufful can evolve into Bewear at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Flailing Pokémon. It boasts power enough to split large trees in half. The organ on its rear releases an odor that it uses to communicate with others of its kind.

name: Bewear
abilities: Fluffy: This Pokemon is vulnerable to fire-type moves, but takes half damage from any melee attack (that isn't fire-type).
Klutz: This Pokémon cannot hold an item.
hidden_ability: Unnerve: Opponents in combat with this Pokémon cannot eat held berries.

asi.description: The Strong Arm Pokémon. It waves its hands wildly in intimidation and warning. Life is over for anyone who doesn’t run away as fast as possible.

name: Bounsweet
abilities: Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.
Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
"Egg_Moves": Acupressure, Charm, Feint, Grass Whistle, Play Rough, Synthesis 34
hidden_ability: Sweet Veil: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.
evolution: Bounsweet can evolve into Steenee at level 6 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Fruit Pokémon. Because of its sweet, delicious aroma, bird Pokémon are always after it, but it’s not intelligent enough to care.

name: Steenee
abilities: Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.
Oblivious: This Pokémon is immune to moves that attempt to charm or taunt it.
hidden_ability: Sweet Veil: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.
evolution: Steenee can evolve into Tsareena at the time it learns Stomp. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 14 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Fruit Pokémon. It’s protected by its hard sepals,so it plays with bird Pokémon without worry. They peck it relentlessly, but it doesn’t care.

name: Tsareena
abilities: Leaf Guard: This Pokémon does not suffer from any negative status ailments in harsh sunlight.
Queen Majesty: Bonus action moves activated by any creature within sight of this Pokémon become standard actions.
hidden_ability: Sweet Veil: Any ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to the sleep condition.

asi.description: The Fruit Pokémon. A master of grand and beautiful kicks, it can knock out even kickboxing champions with a single blow.

name: Comfey
abilities: Flower Veil: Any grass-type ally within 15 feet of this Pokémon is immune to new status effects.
Triage: This Pokémon's healing or draining moves have a move time of 1 bonus action.
"Egg_Moves": After You, Amnesia, Endure, Lucky Chant
hidden_ability: Natural Cure: This Pokémon is cured of negative status ailments upon returning to its Pokeball.

asi.description: The Posy Picker Pokémon. It stretches sticky vines out from its head and picks flowers to adorn itself with. When it doesn’t have any flowers, it feels uneasy.

name: Oranguru
abilities: Inner Focus: This Pokémon is immune to flinching.
Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.
"Egg_Moves": Extrasensory, Psychic Terrain, Wonder Room 36
hidden_ability: Symbiosis: This Pokémon may swap held items with an ally as a free action, as long as they are within 15 feet of each other.

asi.description: The Sage Pokémon. It normally spends its time meditating in the treetops. It throws Poké Balls and gives other Pokémon orders as it pleases.

name: Passimian
abilities: Receiver: When switched in after an ally faints, this Pokémon copies the non-hidden ability of the fainted ally until switched out.
"Egg_Moves": Feint, Iron Head, Quick Attack, Quick Guard, Seismic Toss, Vital Throw
hidden_ability: Defiant: When this Pokémon is subject to a move that gives it a status condition, it has advantage on the next attack.

asi.description: The Teamwork Pokémon. They use their saliva to stick leaves to their shoulders. You can tell what troop they belong to from the position of the leaves.

name: Wimpod
abilities: Wimp Out: When a damaging move causes this Pokémon to fall below 50% of its maximum HP, it MUST disengage and move up to its speed in a straight line towards its trainer as a free action. If this would put the Pokémon in range of switching out, it must do so as another free action if another Pokémon is available to replace it.
"Egg_Moves": Aqua Jet, Harden, Metal Claw, Spikes, Wide Guard 37
evolution: Wimpod can evolve into Golisopod at level 8 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 13 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Turn Tail Pokémon. It will pick up anything it finds on the ground. Sometimes it finds coins, so Murkrow and Meowth will go after it.

name: Golisopod
abilities: Emergency Exit: At any time this Pokémon is damaged when it is at or below 50% of its maximum HP, its trainer may switch it out as a free action.

asi.description: The Hard Scale Pokémon. The shell covering its body is as hard as diamond. This Pokémon will do anything it takes to win.

name: Sandygast
abilities: Water Compaction: After being damaged by a watertype move, any other damage dealt to this Pokémon until the beginning of its next turn is halved.
"Egg_Moves": Amnesia, Ancient Power, Curse, Destiny Bond, Spit Up, Swallow, Stockpile 38
hidden_ability: Sand Veil: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage. In addition, its AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.
evolution: Sandygast can evolve into Palossand at level 11 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Sand Heap Pokémon. It likes the shovel on its head, so Sandygast will get serious and fight any children who come to take it back.

name: Palossand
abilities: Water Compaction: After being damaged by a watertype move, any other damage dealt to this Pokémon until the beginning of its next turn is halved.
hidden_ability: Sand Veil: This Pokémon is immune to Sandstorm damage. In addition, its AC increases by 2 in desert terrain, or during a Sandstorm.

asi.description: The Sand Castle Pokémon. Each of its grains of sand has its own will. Palossand eats small Pokémon and siphons away their vital essence while they’re still alive.

name: Pyukumuku
abilities: Innards Out: When this Pokémon is knocked out by a damaging move, the attacker takes an amount of typeless damage equal to the amount of HP lost.
"Egg_Moves": Bestow, Endure, Spite, Tickle, Venom Drench 39
hidden_ability: Unaware: When this Pokémon attacks an opponent,it ignores any stat boosts the opponent has been affected with after the start of battle. This includes boosts to AC or saving throws the Pokémon has to make.

asi.description: The Sea Cucumber Pokémon. The tradition known as Pyukumuku chucking started from the custom of throwing Pyukumuku back into the sea after they wash onshore.

name: "Type": Null
type: Silvally at level 16 and above if its
When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 11 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).
abilities: Battle Armor: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.

asi.description: The Synthetic Pokémon. A Pokémon weapon developed for a specific mission, it went berserk during an experiment, so it was cryogenically frozen.

name: Silvally
abilities: RKS System: This Pokémon's type is determined by the memory disc it holds. If not holding a memory disc, this Pokémon's type is normal.

asi.description: The Synthetic Pokémon. This is its form once it has awakened and evolved. Freed from its heavy mask,its speed is greatly increased.

name: Minior Meteor Form
abilities: Shields Down: This Pokémon is immune to Non- Volatile status effects while in Meteor Form. When this Pokémon falls below 50% of its maximum hp,its outer shell breaks and it changes to Core Form. In Core Form, it adds 6 points to its DEX, but reduces its AC by 4. The Pokémon must complete a short rest to restore itself to Meteor Form.

asi.description: The Meteor Pokémon. It lives in the ozone layer,where it becomes food for stronger Pokémon. When it tries to run away, it falls to the ground.

name: Minior Core Form
abilities: Shields Down: This Pokémon is immune to Non- Volatile status effects while in Meteor Form. When this Pokémon falls below 50% of its maximum hp,its outer shell breaks and it changes to Core Form. In Core Form, it adds 6 points to its DEX, but reduces its AC by 4. The Pokémon must complete a short rest to restore itself to Meteor Form.

asi.description: The Meteor Pokémon. Places where Minior fall from the night sky are few and far between, with Alola being one of the precious few.

name: Komala
abilities: Comatose: This Pokémon is in a continuous state of drowsiness. It is immune to the sleep condition, but is considered affected by sleep for all moves that require a Pokémon to be asleep to use or activate additional effects (Snore, Sleep Talk, Wake-Up Slap, Dream Eater, etc.)
"Egg_Moves": Charm, Play Rough, Sing, Wish

asi.description: The Drowsing Pokémon. It stays asleep from the moment it’s born. When it falls into a deep sleep, it stops moving altogether.

name: Turtonator
abilities: Shell Armor: This Pokémon is immune to extra damage dealt by a Critical Hit.
"Egg_Moves": Fire Spin, Head Smash, Revenge, Wide Guard 42

asi.description: The Blast Turtle Pokémon. It lives in volcanoes and eats sulfur and other minerals. Materials from the food it eats form the basis of its explosive shell.

name: Togedemaru
abilities: Iron Barbs: When this Pokémon is hit by a melee attack, it may roll a d4. On a 4, deal an amount of damage equal to its proficiency modifier to its attacker.

Lightning Rod: If this Pokemon or an ally within 30 feet is targeted with a direct electric-type, damagedealing move, the Pokemon may use a reaction to redirect the target to itself and take half damage from it if it hits.
"Egg_Moves": Disarming Voice, Encore, Fake Out, Flail, Present, Reversal, Tickle, Twineedle, Wish
hidden_ability: Sturdy: When taking damage equal to half or more of your current HP, roll a d4. On a result of 3 of 4,halve the damage dealt.

asi.description: The Roly-Poly Pokémon. When it’s surprised or agitated, the 14 fur spikes on its back will stand up involuntarily.

name: Mimikyu
abilities: Disguise: This Pokémon has a disguise which gives it a temporary hp boost equal to twice its level. When the temporary hit points fall to zero, the disguise breaks and requires a short rest to repair.
"Egg_Moves": Curse, Destiny Bond, Grudge, Nightmare 43

asi.description: The Disguise Pokémon. It stands in front of a mirror,trying to fix its broken neck as if its life depended on it. It has a hard time getting it right, so it’s crying inside.

name: Bruxish
abilities: Dazzling: Bonus action moves activated by any creature within sight of this Pokémon become standard actions.
Strong Jaw: For biting moves activated by this Pokémon (Bite, Thunder Fang, Crunch, etc.), they may roll the damage twice and choose either total.
"Egg_Moves": Ice Fang, Poison Fang, Rage, Water Pulse
hidden_ability: Wonder Skin: This Pokémon has advantage on all saving throws against being burned, frozen,poisoned, or paralyzed.

asi.description: The Gnash Teeth Pokémon. It burrows beneath the sand, radiating psychic power from the protuberance on its head. It waits for prey as it surveys the area.

name: Drampa
abilities: Berserk: When this Pokémon falls below 25% of its maximum health, all of its attacks are rolled with disadvantage, but deal double their damage. If a move activated requires a saving throw, the target(s) have advantage on the roll.
Sap Sipper: This Pokémon takes no damage from grass-type attacks. If hit by a grass type move, it takes no damage and instead absorbs the energy,granting advantage on its next attack.
"Egg_Moves": Dragon Rush, Hurricane, Mist, Play Rough, Razor Wind 44
hidden_ability: Cloud Nine: While this Pokémon is in battle,weather-related abilities have no effect on the Pokémon that have them.

asi.description: The Placid Pokémon. If a child it has made friends with is bullied, Drampa will find the bully’s house and burn it to the ground.

name: Dhelmise
abilities: Steelworker: This Pokémon adds its proficiency bonus to damage dealt by steel-type moves.

asi.description: The Sea Creeper Pokémon. It wraps its prey in green seaweed and sucks away their vitality. It only likes to go after big prey like Wailord.

name: Jangmo-o
abilities: Bulletproof: This Pokémon is immune to damage from moves with Bullet, Ball, or Bomb in their name.
Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to soundbased moves.
"Egg_Moves": Counter, Dragon Breath, Reversal 45
hidden_ability: Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.
evolution: Jangmo-o can evolve into Hakamo-o at level 9 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 10 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Scaly Pokémon. It smacks the scales on its head against rocks or against the ground to frighten its opponents. It can also contact its friends with these noises.

name: Hakamo-o
abilities: Bulletproof: This Pokémon is immune to damage from moves with Bullet, Ball, or Bomb in their name.
Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to soundbased moves.
hidden_ability: Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.
evolution: Hakamo-o can evolve into Kommo-o at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 12 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Scaly Pokémon. It makes noise by clanging its scales together. When the rhythm has reached its peak, Hakamo-o attacks.

name: Kommo-o
abilities: Bulletproof: This Pokémon is immune to damage from moves with Bullet, Ball, or Bomb in their name.
Soundproof: This Pokémon is immune to soundbased moves.
hidden_ability: Overcoat: This Pokémon does not take damage from weather-related moves like Hail, Weather Ball, etc.

asi.description: The Scaly Pokémon. When it howls after finishing off its prey, the metallic sounds of its celebrating comrades can be heard from all around.

name: Tapu Koko
abilities: Electric Surge: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Electric Terrain move as a bonus action.
hidden_ability: Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

asi.description: The Land Spirit Pokémon. Although it’s called a guardian deity, if a person or Pokémon puts it in a bad mood, it will become a malevolent deity and attack.

name: Tapu Lele
abilities: Psychic Surge: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Psychic Terrain move as a bonus action.
hidden_ability: Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

asi.description: The Land Spirit Pokémon. As it flutters about, it scatters its strangely glowing scales. Touching them is said to restore good health on the spot.

name: Tapu Bulu
abilities: Grassy Surge: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Grassy Terrain move as a bonus action.
hidden_ability: Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

asi.description: The Land Spirit Pokémon. Although it’s called a guardian deity, it’s violent enough to crush anyone it sees as an enemy.

name: Tapu Fini
abilities: Misty Surge: If the move is known, this Pokémon may use the Misty Terrain move as a bonus action.
hidden_ability: Telepathy: This Pokémon cannot be damaged by its allies' attacks.

asi.description: The Land Spirit Pokémon. This guardian deity of Poni Island manipulates water. Because it lives deep within a thick fog, it came to be both feared and revered.

name: Cosmog
abilities: Unaware: When this Pokémon attacks an opponent,it ignores any stat boosts the opponent has been affected with after the start of battle. This includes boosts to AC or saving throws the Pokémon has to make.
evolution: Cosmog can evolve into Cosmoem at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 17 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Nebula Pokémon. Even though its helpless,gaseous body can be blown away by the slightest breeze, it doesn’t seem to care.

name: Cosmoem
abilities: Sturdy: When taking damage equal to half or more of your current HP, roll a d4. On a result of 3 of 4,halve the damage dealt.
evolution: Cosmoem can evolve into Solgaleo at level 16 and above during the day, or Lunala at level 16 and above at night. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 14 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Protostar Pokémon. The king who ruled Alola in times of antiquity called it the “cocoon of the stars” and built an altar to worship it.

name: Solgaleo
abilities: Full Metal Body: Other Pokémon's moves or abilities cannot lower this Pokémon stats.

asi.description: The Sunne Pokémon. Sometimes the result of its opening an Ultra Wormhole is that energy and lifeforms from other worlds are called here to this world.

name: Lunala
abilities: Shadow Shield: If this Pokémon is at full health, the first damage dealt to it is halved.

asi.description: The Moone Pokémon. Records of it exist in writings from long, long ago, where it was known by the name “the beast that calls the moon.”

name: Nihilego
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Parasite Pokémon. A life-form from another world, it was dubbed an Ultra Beast and is thought to produce a strong neurotoxin.

name: Buzzwole
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Swollen Pokémon. Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Pheromosa
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Lissome Pokémon. A life-form that lives in another world, its body is thin and supple, but it also possesses great power.

name: Xurkitree
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Glowing Pokémon. Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Celesteela
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Launch Pokémon. One kind of Ultra Beast. Witnesses have seen it burn down a forest by expelling gas from its two arms.

name: Kartana
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Drawn Sword Pokémon. This Ultra Beast’s body,which is as thin as paper, is like a sharpened sword.

name: Guzzlord
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Junkivore Pokémon. Although it’s alien to this world and a danger here, it’s apparently a common organism in the world where it normally lives.

name: Necrozma
abilities: Prism Armor: When this Pokémon is subject to damage in its vulnerabilities list, roll the damage dice twice and use the lower result for the damage calculation.

asi.description: The Prism Pokémon. It looks somehow pained as it rages around in search of light, which serves as its energy. It’s apparently from another world.

form_change: Necrozma can fuse with a willing Solgaleo, at will, with the help of the N-Solarizer, or Lunala with the help of the N-Lunarizer. The fusion will result in a Dusk Mane Necrozma (if fused with Solgaleo) or Dawn Wings Necrozma (if fused with Lunala) with the same current HP.

name: Dusk Mane Necrozma
abilities: Prism Armor: When this Pokémon is subject to damage in its vulnerabilities list, roll the damage dice twice and use the lower result for the damage calculation.

asi.description: The Prism Pokémon. This is Necrozma’s form while it’s absorbing the power of Solgaleo, making it extremely ferocious and impossible to control.

form_change: Dusk Mane Necrozma can transform into Ultra Necrozma as a bonus action on its turn. When it does, the transformation is treated as a permanent mega evolution, following the rules as stated in the Pokémon 5e Player Handbook.

name: Dawn Wings Necrozma
abilities: Prism Armor: When this Pokémon is subject to damage in its vulnerabilities list, roll the damage dice twice and use the lower result for the damage calculation.

asi.description: The Prism Pokémon. This is its form while it’s devouring the light of Lunala. It grasps foes in its giant claws and rips them apart with brute force.

form_change: Dawn Wings Necrozma can transform into Ultra Necrozma as a bonus action on its turn. When it does, the transformation is treated as a permanent mega evolution, following the rules as stated in the Pokémon 5e Player Handbook.

name: Ultra Necrozma
abilities: Neuroforce: When this Pokémon damages a creature with a super effective move, it may roll the damage dice twice and use the higher result.

asi.description: The Prism Pokémon. The light pouring out from all over its body affects living things and nature,impacting them in various ways.

name: Magearna
abilities: Soul-Heart: Upon seeing an ally faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Artificial Pokémon. It synchronizes its consciousness with others to understand their feelings. This faculty makes it useful for taking care of people.

name: Marshadow
abilities: Technician: For damaging moves activated by this Pokémon with 15 max PP or more, they may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

asi.description: The Gloomdweller Pokémon. It slips into the shadows of others and mimics their powers and movements. As it improves, it becomes stronger than those it’s imitating.

name: Poipole
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.
evolution: Poipole can evolve into Naganadel at level 16 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 9 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Poison Pin Pokémon. An Ultra Beast that lives in a different world, it cackles wildly as it sprays its opponents with poison from the needles on its head.

name: Naganadel
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Poison Pin Pokémon. One kind of Ultra Beast, it fires a glowing, venomous liquid from its needles. This liquid is also immensely adhesive.

name: Stakataka
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Rampart Pokémon. It appeared from an Ultra Wormhole. Each one appears to be made up of many life-forms stacked one on top of each other.

name: Blacephalon
abilities: Beast Boost: Upon causing an opponent to faint, this Pokémon increases the ability scores of its saving throw proficiencies by 2 until the end of combat. This is stackable up to a maximum of +10 to any one ability score.

asi.description: The Fireworks Pokémon. It slithers toward people. Then, without warning, it triggers the explosion of its own head. It’s apparently one kind of Ultra Beast.

name: Zeraora
abilities: Volt Absorb: This Pokémon takes no damage from electricity or electric-type attacks. Instead, half of any electric damage done is absorbed, restoring the Pokémon's HP.

asi.description: The Thunderclap Pokémon. It electrifies its claws and tears its opponents apart with them. Even if they dodge its attack, they’ll be electrocuted by the flying sparks.

name: Meltan
abilities: Magnet Pull: Steel opponents in battle with this Pokémon may not switch out or flee.
evolution: Meltan can evolve into Melmetal at level 10 and above. When it evolves, its health increases by double its level, and it gains 16 points to add to its ability scores (max 20).

asi.description: The Hex Nut Pokémon. It dissolves and eats metal. Circulating liquid metal within its body is how it generates energy.

name: Melmetal
abilities: Iron Fist: When attacking with a punch-based move (Mega Punch, Dynamic Punch, IceFireThunder Punch, etc.), this Pokémon may roll the damage twice and choose either total.

asi.description: The Hex Nut Pokémon. At the end of its life-span, Melmetal will rust and fall apart. The small shards left behind will eventually be reborn as Meltan.
